**Sticky Flame** is a level 4 [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy")/[Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic") spell which causes the target to burn for several rounds.

[Alchemists](/Alchemist "Alchemist") start with this spell in their libraries.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 Monster Version](#Monster_Version)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 References](#References)

## Useful Info

Sticky Flame deals direct [fire](/Fire "Fire") damage, then inflicts the **Fire** status (**covered in liquid fire**). The Fire status deals `2d(3 + power/14)` fire damage per turn, ignoring [AC](/AC "AC").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) It also causes the target to become [backlit](/Backlit "Backlit"), making them easier to hit, and revealing [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible") creatures.

The Fire status lasts for `3 + power/20` to `3 + power/10` turns.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

When the target physically moves, the Fire status will quickly run out. For monsters, each movement reduces duration by 5 turns. For players, each move reduces duration by 6 turns. For players only, if your post-movement duration is ≤ 2 turns, the status automatically ends. Also, entering or being in [water](/Water "Water") (even when [flying](/Flying "Flying")) will immediately end the Fire status.

[Insubstantial](/Insubstantial "Insubstantial") creatures are immune to the Fire status, but still take impact damage from the spell.

## Strategy

A moderately strong damage spell, good for those who don't mind getting into melee range. You can open a fight with Sticky Flame, then use [Flame Wave](/Flame_Wave "Flame Wave") or a melee attack. The main downside is the 1-tile range, which isn't great for squishy casters. Many monsters, such as [hydras](/Hydra "Hydra"), are too dangerous to engage in melee.

Note that Sticky Flame deals a fair amount of impact damage. You should use other spells if available, but if you have nothing better, this spell can be decent to spam.

### Tips & Tricks

- Sticky Flame can be used to reveal [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible") monsters (use **Z** on a suspected tile). This isn't useful against [unseen horrors](/Unseen_horror "Unseen horror"), since they constantly move around. Neither can it be used on [shadows](/Shadow "Shadow"), since they are insubstantial. But it does work against [sky beasts](/Sky_beast "Sky beast") and casters of [Invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility").

## Monster Version

Most monsters use [Pyre Arrow](/Pyre_Arrow "Pyre Arrow"), which inflicts the Fire status from range, but doesn't deal impact damage.

[Player ghosts](/Player_ghost "Player ghost") will cast Sticky Flame, however.

## History

- In [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), Sticky Flame was reworked. Prior to this version:

  - Sticky Flame was a level 4 [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")/[Fire](/Fire "Fire") spell, and it only dealt `2d(1.5 + power/24)` impact damage.
  - The Fire status dealt always dealt 2d4 damage; it did not depend on power.
  - The duration was equal to `4.5 * levels`turns, for levels = `(pow/96 + 1.37)`.
  - The Fire status did not expire faster when the target moves.

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), the Fire status dealt `2d4 - 1` damage per turn. However, [attacks of opportunity](/Attacks_of_opportunity "Attacks of opportunity") didn't exist, so the spell was more viable to normal speed species.

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), [Fire Elementalists](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist") started with this spell.

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), the Fire status wasn't [dispellable](/Dispel "Dispel").

- Earlier versions had more ways for players to gain resistance to sticky flames:

  - Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), [Tiamat](/Tiamat "Tiamat")'s [dragonskin cloak](/Dragonskin_cloak "Dragonskin cloak") had a 50% chance of providing sticky flame resistance when hit by sticky flames
  - Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), [mottled draconians](/Draconian "Draconian") and players wearing [mottled dragon scales](/Mottled_dragon_scales "Mottled dragon scales") were always resistant

- Prior to [0.22](/0.22 "0.22"), Sticky Flame would spread between adjacent [sheep](/Sheep "Sheep") and [dream sheep](/Dream_sheep "Dream sheep").

- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), Sticky Flame's enchantment level depended on the victim's [HD](/HD "HD") rather than the power of the spell.

## References

Player ghosts will cast Sticky Flame, however.

History

  • In 0.31, Sticky Flame was reworked. Prior to this version:
    • Sticky Flame was a level 4 Conjurations/Fire spell, and it only dealt 2d(1.5 + power/24) impact damage.
